--- title: fastgpu keywords: fastai sidebar: home_sidebar summary: "A queue service for quickly developing scripts that use all your GPUs efficiently" --- 
from nbdev.showdoc import *

class NVIDIAGPUs[source]

NVIDIAGPUs()

Vends locked access to NVIDIA GPUs.

NVIDIAGPUs.is_available[source]

NVIDIAGPUs.is_available(gpu_id)

If a GPU's used_memory is less than 30M then it will be regarded as available.

g = NVIDIAGPUs()
t = g.is_available(0)
lockedID = g.lock_next()
nextLockedID = g.lock_next()
lockedID
nextLockedID
g.unlock(lockedID)
g._is_locked(0)

Requirements¶

Optional xtras

  • 2nd line of script, if a comment, is added as a description to the log
path = Path('data')
path.mkdir(exist_ok=True)
path_run = path/'to_run'
path_running = path/'running'
path_complete = path/'complete'
path_fail = path/'fail'
path_out = path/'out'

setup_dirs[source]

setup_dirs(path)

def _create_tests():
    os.symlink('/bin/ls', path_run/'ls')
    os.symlink('/bin/false', path_run/'false')
    (path_run/'test_dir').mkdir(exist_ok=True)

def _setup_test_env():
    shutil.rmtree('data')
    path.mkdir(exist_ok=True)
    res = setup_dirs(path)
    _create_tests()

_setup_test_env()

find_next_script[source]

find_next_script(p)

test_eq(find_next_script(path_run).name, 'false')
assert not find_next_script(path_complete)

is_available[source]

is_available(i, p)

find_next_workerid[source]

find_next_workerid(worker_ids, p)

lock_worker[source]

lock_worker(p, wid, details='')

unlock_worker[source]

unlock_worker(p, wid)

_setup_test_env()

unlock_worker(path, 0)
worker_ids = L.range(4)
test_eq(find_next_workerid(worker_ids, path), 0)
lock_worker(path, 0);
test_eq(find_next_workerid(worker_ids, path), 1)
  1. X poll a directory
  2. X find first file
  3. X check there's an available worker id
  4. X move it to running
  5. run it
    1. X create lock file
    2. X redirect stdout/err
    3. X run it
    4. X when done, move it to complete or failed
    5. X unlock

safe_rename[source]

safe_rename(file, dest)

run_1script[source]

run_1script(script, path_complete, path_fail, path_out, path, wid)

_setup_test_env()
f = find_next_script(path_run)
run_1script(f, path_complete, path_fail, path_out, path, 0)

test_eq(find_next_script(path_run), path_run/'ls')
test_eq((path_out/'false.exitcode').read_text(), '1')
assert (path_fail/'false').exists()

poll_scripts[source]

poll_scripts(worker_ids, p, poll_interval=0.1)

_setup_test_env()
poll_scripts(worker_ids, path)

assert not find_next_script(path_run), find_next_script(path_run)
test_eq((path_out/'false.exitcode').read_text(), '1')
test_eq((path_out/'ls.exitcode').read_text(), '0')
assert not (path_run/'false').exists()
assert (path_fail/'false').exists()
assert (path_complete/'ls').exists()
assert 'README.md' in (path_out/'ls.stdout').read_text()
